description.raw:
This change modifies calc_version in setup.py to return a simple version
string when on tagged changeset that has not been modified (for a release).

There are a few caveats:

- In order for the version strings to show up normally, the current tagging
  convention has to change from a "release-{version}" to simply "{version}".
  This a documented aspect of hgtools.

- All modifications need to be committed, then tagged (which creates its own
  commit but will not commit any local changes) to ensure that that the
  version number tagged shows up correctly.

As far as the code change is concerned from looking through the
VersionManagement interface documented at
https://github.com/jaraco/hgtools/blob/master/hgtools/versioning.py (which
RepoManager inherits from and no-ops the remainder of the interface) I do not
know of a better way of detecting whether or not we're on an unmodified tagged
changeset or not other than checking the string returned (and if it ends with
'dev').
